info.label: Full Stack Developer
info.brief: Full-Stack developer w/ 5+ years of experience. Flight Simulator IO specialist, and Military Contractor 'go-to guy' in a past life. Open Source Software Ninja. Problem solver. Leader when necessary. Accustomed to, working on small specialized teams, interfacing with customers, quickly adapting to a new technologies, and working on the bleeding-edge.
info.quote: Leave it better than you found it

history.position: Lead Installation and Repair Field Technician
history.summary: High speed, low drag copper specialist. Installing Century Link DSL and POTS services.
highlights: Provided leadership, training, and QA for the field techs
Served 1K+ customers

history.summary: DISH Field Technician. Performing satellite installations, repairs, upgrades, and migrations.
highlights: Served 1.5+ customers

history.summary: West Coast representative for MARCORSYSCOM Combat Camera. Providing logistics and support.
highlights: Fielded, tracked, and supported $5+ million in military hardware
Support 11 Combat Camera units across 6 military installations
Acted as regional SME for the TIPS (Tactical Imagery Production System)
Provided onsite support 3 field exercises
Hosted of semi-annual traning evolutions for the TIPS
Certified Xerox MFD field technician
Setup and trained coworkers to use S3 for monthly distribution of OS images
Authored an automation suite for Excel->PDF form filling
Designed and maintained company website

history.summary: Hacking on commercial full flight aircraft simulators for fun and profit.
highlights: Design/implement various avionics and aircraft systems updates incl, EGPWS, TCAS, TAWS, glass, analog, etc
Full Stack development of a website + inventory DB using a LAMP stack
Full lifecycle product design/architecture/development of milti-touchscreen interface using C#/MSSQL
Designed and implemented a custom layer2 networking protocol
Partnered on many projects with Rotran Ltd, packing/installing/relocating and FAA certifying various Full Flight Simulators

history.summary: Build commercial full flight simulators. Avionics, cabling, instrument panels, I/O, and instrument calibrations.
highlights: Built cabling and installed/calibrated avionics and aircraft systems

projects.summary: Reusable Angular Resume component using the FRESCA format

projects.title: ng2-markdown (OSS)
projects.summary: Reusable Angular Markdown component with syntax highlighting
highlights: Published to JSPM

projects.title: node-ftpsync (OSS)
highlights: One-command incremental synchronization
Grunt wrapper (grunt-ftpsync) available
Published to NPM

projects.title: jquery-csv (OSS)
projects.summary: The first RFC 4180 complete lexer/parser for Javascript. Migrated from Google Code.
highlights: 500K+ downloads
Efficient hand-rolled DFA parser
Published to NPM, Bower, CDNJS, Maven, Ruby Gems

projects.title: SharpPcap/Packet.Net (OSS)
projects.summary: Fully managed, cross platform (Windows, Mac, Linux) .NET library for capturing packets
highlights: Implemented/revised various networking protocols
Added additional unit and performance tests
Added additional examples
Updated documentation via CodePen

projects.title: Replacement Instructor Operating Station (Proprietary)
projects.summary: A mission critical multi-touchscreen interface for commercial flight simulators.
highlights: First full lifecycle greenfield product development
250K in revenue
Architect of all systems, components, IPC, and network communications
Specified, assembled, configured, custom hardware incl hot/cold spares for redundancy
First turnkey hardware product implementation
Successful acceptance - 90 days @ 99.9% uptime
